data.title: Readline library compile issues
data.body:
I'm currently having problems getting the latest to build in Windows. I got the packages here: http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/readline.htm. I got passed through CMAKE setting the paths but still getting path errors.

Perhaps include this to ThirdParty folder/libraries?

data.title: Gui Text Control doesn't show hyphens.
data.body: Gui Text Control doesn't show hyphens (the "-" character).

data.title: Rakefile error in windows
data.body:
this line:
abs_path = (ENV['OS'] ? ENV['dir'][1, 1] == ':' : ENV['dir'][0, 1] == '/') ? ENV['dir'] : "#{Dir.pwd}/#{ENV['dir']}"

produces:
rake aborted!
can't modify frozen string

fix: add the dup:
abs_path = (ENV['OS'] ? ENV['dir'][1, 1] == ':' : ENV['dir'][0, 1] == '/') ? ENV['dir'].dup : "#{Dir.pwd}/#{ENV['dir']}"

Regards.

data.title: Update SDL to version 2.0.4
data.body:
I started with the transfer of SDL 2.0.4 source (`release-2.0.4`, `10001:e12c38730512`, https://hg.libsdl.org/SDL/file/e12c38730512 ) to Urho3D source tree.

Parallel work on getting SDL 2.0.4 into Urho3D: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/1123 .

data.title: RenderSurface::QueueUpdate() renders after the main viewports
C89 compliance in SDL_windowsevents.c when compiling under MSVC2012
data.body:
The error message is:

```
error C2275: 'SDL_Mouse' : illegal use of this type as an expression SDL_windowsevents.c    426    1    SDL
```

This happens because MSVC will compile all `*.c` files using the C compiler in C89 mode, meaning all variables must be declared at the beginning of each scope. A change previously made by an Urho3D developer violated this constraint (see diff for more info).

GCC and clang will by default ignore such errors and only generate a warning.

Merged into one commit, checkout this.

data.title: AnimatedModel::OnWorldBoundingBoxUpdate() doesn't update boneBoundingBox_
data.body:
AnimatedModel's bounding box gets updated by the render process. Since it only gets updated by the render process that means the bone bounding box is always a frame behind.

In my case I need the AnimatedModel bounding box to be correct before any rendering happens.

A quick solution is making UpdateBoneBoundingBox() public so the user can do it if needed.

But in general for correct result at all times the bone bounding box should be updated in OnWorldBoundingBoxUpdate(). For some reason there's a comment in that code that says "Note: do not update bone bounding box here, instead do it in either of the threaded updates". If it's done for performance reasons and in the general case the bone bounding box needs to update for rendering, then just exposing UpdateBoneBoundingBox() should be sufficient.

data.title: Add CodeLite CMake generator
data.body:
CMake provides a generator for CodeLite project files. I cannot make a PR currently due to security settings on my system that prevents Git access, and the web interface sucks.

cmake_codelite.bat:

> @"%~dp0cmake_generic.bat" %\* -G "CodeLite - MinGW Makefiles"

cmake_codelite.sh:

> $(dirname $0)/cmake_generic.sh "$@" -G "CodeLite - Unix Makefiles"

data.title: Add tags to UIElement
data.body: For now without bindings and attributes. Any notes?

data.title: Add view matrix
data.body: Added a view matrix uniform to the shader code. The impetus for this is to allow me to convert world-space normals into view-space normals to perform SSAO calculations in the rendering pipeline.

data.title: For Travis CI and AppVeyor - test run should not wait indefinitely when a sample being tested popup a dialog box
data.body:
Currently our test run is designed to execute the samples for 5 seconds. The test is considered pass when there is no segmentation fault within this 5 seconds. However, in some situation the 5 seconds time out action cannot occur because the offending sample has popped out a dialog box and preventing our time out mechanism.

Travis CI automatically kills the CI job whenever there is no log activity for 10 minutes. Not sure how long in AppVeyor. This is not good in two ways.
1. The CI job waits for 10 minutes for nothing when it can actually move on and use the valuable slot for starting other CI jobs. Our free account entitled for only max 5 slots on Travis CI and 1 slot on AppVeyor, respectively.
2. The build status shows as `error` instead of `failed` which is more appropriate in this case.

A better way is needed to time out the sample during test run. Low priority. Nice to have.

data.title: [Editor] AttributeAnimation support.
data.body: Allowing the user to animate attributes, or even create value or object animations and save those to a file would be a valuable addition to the editor.
